div.p: I'm a self-taught software & DevOps engineer with a passion for producing high quality solutions to real-world problems. I pick up new languages and ecosystems quickly and I am always learning!
I work on making wholesome video games and source-available game tooling at Katharos Technology.
Most of my Open Source contributions are in the 🦀 Rust ecosystem, including:

ul.li: WGPU: Helped implement WebGL2 support, which was used in the Bevy game engine.
egui: Added the option to specify texture filters so you can display pixel art, and implemented custom paint-callbacks for WGPU.
FishFight: Added critters and other miscellaneous fixes and items.
Bevy Retrograde: Created a work-in-progress, source-available plugin pack for 2D Bevy games.

div.p: You can also solicit my help for an Open Source project by creating a gig on my GitHub repo. My specialties are:

ul.li:
Building modern web applications with Vue.js and Quasar
I also know how to target Desktop platforms with Tauri
DevOps, automation, and general problem solving
Writing technical documentation that is approachable by beginners

div.p: Sponsorship will help me continue learning and working on open source or source-available projects in an effort make the internet more free ( as in freedom ), to help people, and maybe share some fun with wholesome video games and tools to make them. 🎮
I'll update this section as I work on different things to show what I'm spending my time on. Currently my time is divided between two major categories.

I'm learning how to decentralize applications and communication with technologies such as zero-knowledge proofs, blockchains, and mesh networks, with the hope of bringing a more free ( as in freedom ) internet to everyday people, with a great user experience.
Post-quantum secure signature and KEM algorithms suitable for encrypting traffic in a peer-to-peer mesh network.
How to create virtual network adapters that can create an IPv6 virtual network adapter on top of a mesh network, very similar to cjdns but with post-quantum secure encryption.
I'm doing some work on FishFight, a pixel-style, competitive 2D shooter.
I'm also working on Bounty Bros., a Legend of Zelda® inspired, story-driven mini-game.
Working on an NES/Famicom background, sprite, and map editor designed for helping you write actual NES games. 👀
